channel.title: AI & Telecom News Digest
channel.description: Daily AI & Telecom insights curated by n8n + Perplexity

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Telecoms must adopt generative AI to reduce costs, drive growth, enhance security, and transform into technology companies offering AI-powered services.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article highlights 150 AI use cases from leading startups, featuring Cursor, an AI-powered code editor with advanced generative AI and autonomous agent capabilities.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The report highlights growing generative AI adoption in telecom, with half of industry respondents having implemented their first AI solutions by 2025.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Singtel Enterprise is investing heavily in AI to become an AI-first telco, focusing on network slicing, digital twins, and autonomous networks.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Deloitte Insights forecasts telcos exploring growth opportunities by integrating generative AI into their 2025 business strategies.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The European Commission will reveal its new strategy on 8 October to promote AI adoption across various European sectors.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The article lists the top 26 generative AI companies in October 2025, highlighting their expertise in ChatGPT, large language models, and AI-driven business solutions.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Generative AI, combined with AI-native platforms, zero trust, and quantum encryption, is driving the next growth wave in telecom enterprise security.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: PwC's 2025 AI Business Predictions outline key trends and strategies driving AI-driven business transformation in the coming years.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: A new report highlights that 83% of telecom leaders fear falling behind and urges telcos to adopt Gen AI to achieve productivity gains desired by 63%.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Morgan Stanley’s TMT 2025 conference highlights emerging generative AI trends and innovations driving the future of technology, media, and telecom industries.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: The Richmond Fed compares AI investment growth to the telecom boom, exploring if the current AI surge represents a similar speculative bubble.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Deloitte predicts that rapid generative AI adoption and telecom advancements will drive a transformative leap in the Technology, Media, and Telecom (TMT) sector by 2025.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Malaysia launches Ryt Bank, its first AI-powered bank, while Google's Veo 3 AI video creation tools become widely available, signaling major AI-driven innovations in finance and media.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Leading telecom companies are rapidly adopting agentic AI to transform operations, becoming faster and more efficient, according to McKinsey insights.

item.title: Untitled
item.description: Telefónica highlights public cloud trends as major hyperscalers like AWS, Azure, and GCP integrate generative AI, foundational models, and synthetic data.
